8.heading: Chan, Cheng-Li.
8.title: Doug's Big Comeback
8.author: created by Jim Jinkins ; adapted by Nancy E
8.appears_in: Krulik ; illustrated by Peter List, Cheng-li Chan, Tony Curanaj, Chris Dechert, Brian Donnelly, Ray Feldman, Chris Palesty, Matt Peters, and Jonathan Royce.
notes: (Disney Chapters)
"Jumbo Pictures."

Summary: Doug has always been the target of Roger's taunts, until lately he learned to put down Roger, and everyone is laughing. But now Doug just can't stop being Mr. Funny Guy at the expense of his friends' feelings, until he realizes the comeback remark isn't always as funny as it seems.

86.heading: Chan, Jackie.
86.title: Cheng shi lie ren [videorecording] = City Hunter
86.author: jian zhi Cai Lan ; dao yan, bian ju Wong Jing.
notes: 1 videodisc : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in.
Cast: Jackie Chan, Joey Wong.
DVD.

Summary (from OCLC): Ryu Saeba, hired to find a runaway daughter, discovers her location on a cruise ship. Instead of focusing on returning the woman he wants to become romantically involved with her. When criminals hijack the ship to hold the passengers for ransom, its up to Ryo to save the day.
Originally released as a motion picture in 1992.
In Cantonese or English with Chinese and English subtitles.
"Based on a popular Japanese comic strip."

Special features: exclusive interviews with cast and crew, new City Hunter outtakes video, Jackie Chan movie photo gallery and biography, movie photo gallery, new and original trailers, original promotional materials.

97.heading: Chanakya.
97.title: "Chandragupta Maurya : the Determined Prince"
97.author: script, Subba Rao ; illustrations, Ram Waeerkar ; editor, Anant Pai
97.appears_in: p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 634 (1978, 2009 printing).
notes: (Bravehearts)

"Chandragupta Maurya defeated the Nandas and established himself on the throne of Magadha in 321 B.C. It was a journey fraught with dangerous challenges but his chance meeting with the wily Chanakya changed his destiny forever. The clever Brahmin showed him how by the sheer brilliance of his wit and wile he could help the young Mauryan prince to rise from being an unknown warrior to one of the greatest emperors of India."

98.title: "Chanakya : the Kingmaker"
98.author: retold by Yagya Sharma ; artwork, Ram Waeerkar
98.appears_in: 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 508 (1992).
notes: (Visionaries)

Summary from back cover: "Was Chanakya a demon or a man? His opponents had no answer. They would plot and plan, coax and connive, but the scholar-turned-politician was always a step ahead, confounding both their motives and their ambitions. He led his king, Chandragupta, to greatness, and set his kingdom on the road to peace and prosperity. Then, for generations of future rulers, he compiled a useful guide, the famously canny Arthashastra."
Subtitle, series and summary from 2010 printing.

99.title: "Temps Partagés, Temps Retrouvés : Lecture sous Influence"
99.author: Hugues de Chanay
99.appears_in: p. 90-94 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 9 (Oct. 2003).
notes: Begins: "Les quelques réflexions qui suivent sont nées du plaisir pris à la lecture du Journal de Fabrice Neaud. Remontant à la source de ce plaisir, j'ai cru y trouver des polyphonies temporelles et une empathie somatique: mots un peu opaques que je vais tâcher d'éclaircir"

English summary (from p. 127): "Time Shared, Time Recalled. Hugues de Chanay hypothesizes that Neaud's diary is deliberately conceived in such a way as to create an interior rhythm of thought in the reader. He examines the manner in which the time of the events recounted mingles with that of remembrance and of the real time of reading, these three planes intermixing on both pictorial and linguistic levels."
